subject: Dear
body:
Dear
 
Below is fiduciary account to transfer US$ 11,500.
We are using below fiduciary account to receive payments because of sanctions.
 
Bank Name: Industrial And Commercial Bank Of China (Asia) Limited.
Address: 33/F ICBC Tower, 3 Garden Road, Central, Hong Kong
Account Name: H. K. B.
Account Number: 95450600XXXX
Swift Code: UBHKHKHHXXX
 
 
After making the transfer send us the transfer slip for our confirmation.
 
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re:   Dear
body:
Dear Bakaev A. Marsovich,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate you sharing this information with me. Could you please provide me with more details about the fiduciary account? I would like to understand how it works and what the process is for making a transfer.

Additionally, could you clarify what you mean by "sanctions"? I want to make sure I have a clear understanding of the situation.

Thank you again for sharing this information with me. I look forward to hearing back from you.

Best wishes,
Jon

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Jon
 
Fiduciary account is bank account the refinery uses to receive payments outside seller country, money transfer is same normal way of transfering money with MT103 telegrafic transfer.
Sanction is if seller country or bank is under sanction, the seller provides bank account outside seller country to receive payment.
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
--
Contractorg Oil
    
 
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Bakaev A. Marsovich,

Thank you for reaching out and providing me with this information about fiduciary accounts and money transfers. It's interesting to learn about the different methods used in the oil industry.

I have a few follow-up questions, if you don't mind. How common is it for refineries to use fiduciary accounts? Are there any specific advantages or disadvantages to using this type of account?

Additionally, could you please explain more about sanctions and how they affect the payment process? What happens if a seller country or bank is under sanction?

Thank you again for sharing your knowledge on this topic.

Best wishes,
Jon

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Jon
 
Refineries uses fiduciary accounts and there is no disadvantage once the account is officially issued in the refinery invoice.
Countries under international sanctions can’t receive payment from the countries that sanctioned them and in such case the seller provides fiduciary account outside seller country for product payment.
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Bakaev A. Marsovich,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information about refineries and fiduciary accounts. I find it quite interesting. Could you please explain a bit more about how these fiduciary accounts work? How are they different from regular bank accounts?

Also, you mentioned that countries under sanctions can receive payment through these accounts. That's intriguing. Are there any specific regulations or procedures in place for such transactions? I'm curious to know more about how this process works.

Thank you again for sharing your knowledge on this topic!

Best wishes,
Jon

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Jon
 
We don’t have to spend time on this, there is nothing more to explain.
If we receive your ICPO, the refinery will issue contract with account to receive payment.
Payment transfer is same as is done everywhere.
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re: Dear
body:

Also, could you explain what you mean by "payment transfer is same as is done"? I want to ensure that everything is clear before proceeding.

Best wishes,

subject: Re: Dear
body:

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Jon
 
ICPO full meaning is Irrevocable Corporate Purchase Order.
Check attached guide line to address ICPO.
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Bakaev A. Marsovich,

Thank you for sharing this information about ICPO and its full meaning, which is Corporate Purchase Order. I appreciate your willingness to provide guidance on how to address ICPOs.

Could you please tell me more about the purpose of an ICPO? How does it differ from a regular purchase order? Are there any specific industries or sectors where ICPOs are commonly used?

Thank you again for your help!

Best wishes,
Jon

subject: Re: Dear
body:
Dear Jon
 
I am in petroleum products field, what I know is document required to start up petroleum product purchase.
I don’t have all the time to keep answering questions that is why I sent you the ICPO addressing guide lines, follow the ICPO addressing guide line to address your ICPO.
Regards
Bakaev A. Marsovich
 
--
Contractorg Oil

subject: Re: Dear
body:
